body.name: ECR4Kids 5-Compartment Mobile Storage Cabinet, 24in, Classroom Furniture, Grey Wash
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 5 hrs 4 mins
features: Storage Cabinet: Versatile shelving unit with five spacious compartments for storing and organizing school supplies, STEAM activities, and personal belongings in a classroom, playroom, or bedroom
Easy to Reach: Perfect height for children to self-help; introducing organizational skills at a young age helps kids handle information in a logical way, prioritize activities and build self-esteem
Durable Finish: A grey stain is applied using a multi-step process highlighting the natural features and grain of the wood making each piece truly unique; designed to withstand daily wear and tear
Certified Safe: Bookcase is GREENGUARD [GOLD] Certified for low VOCs, TSCA, and CPSIA compliant; features rounded edges and smooth surfaces for safety
Product Dimensions: The kids bookshelf measures 48" W x 13" D x 24" H; storage is easy to assemble, adult assembly required
body.description: Keep your daycare, preschool, and home organized with ECR4Kids 5-Section Mobile Storage Cabinet. The multipurpose storage solution provides ample space to display and organize books, games, and arts and crafts supplies. Make playtime more manageable with displays of developmentally appropriate toys; rearrange play spaces with too many options. Use this toy rotation storage to bring excitement back as playthings are refreshed. Designed to grow with little ones, this organizer helps parents, teachers, and educators keep small items off the floor and within reach. The low-profile open-face shelves encourage children to select their favorite activity independently and introduce organizational skills and clean up when playtime is over. Four casters are included for mobility; move the book display from a reading space to a craft room. Constructed from sustainably harvested birch plywood with a tough UV lacquer that seals the wood surface and resists scratching. A UV inhibitor makes furniture resistant to ultraviolet light and yellowing. Natural birch plywood is durable and designed for everyday use in a commercial or institutional environment, and great for the home. The natural grain complements any space. Combine the Montessori storage with ECR4Kids Birch Collection furniture pieces to complete the space; sold separately.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Developmental Benefits Autonomy Encourage children to care for belongings and build autonomy. Students develop confidence and responsibility with tasks that allow children to control their environment, like putting away their coats, bags, and personal items in designated places. Organizational Skills Keep small pieces contained and rooms clutter free so that children can focus on tasks. Neatly store bags, coats, and personal items within reach. Use organizing storage units to help teach responsibility and make clean up a breeze. Child Size Create an interactive that is space built to scale for little learners. Proportionally sized items promote confidence and independence. Little ones take ownership of their learning as they navigate a kid-sized environment. Daily Routine Create smooth transitions with predictable daily routines. When students have a designated locker or cubby space for their belongings, they can move independently and confidently between tasks in the classroom. Give children a place to keep personal items so that their daily routines support an organized and focused learning environment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best Nordic-style bookshelves & a steal for the cost
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE these shelves. I love that the 24" comes exactly to the height of the window sills in my 1908 house. I love that they are made of solid, laminated birch and that the laminations are so beautifully done, they look like art, not plywood. I love that the shelves have low casters, hidden under a bottom skirt, so that even when full they move smoothly and easily when Christmas comes and we want to put the tree in front of a window. I love that they hold a lot, that the light finish is durable & lasting, that you would never in a million years suspect these of being classroom furniture, yet they cost far less than a comparable "proper" living room bookshelf would cost.The only extra work they take is the removal of the wood-burned logo in the center of the bottom skirt. I don't like logo wear anywhere, and especially not on my furniture, so before assembly, I simply take a little time to lightly hand-sand the area until the wood-burned design is gone. Adds maybe 10-15 work to the total, but they go together so easily, even the extra work doesn't make assembly a big deal.There are two of these in my living room, now, and I have other areas in the house where I'd like to replace cheaper and/or chunkier shelves, or totally different pieces of furniture, with more of these. They're just so pretty, and so practical, why wouldn't I?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I got the first one to see how good quality it was. And I loved it. It was very easy to assemble, and the material is good quality. All the pieces are well made to fit perfectly together. Also, the design and color are beautiful. It gave a better look to my daycare. So, at the end I got two more to complete the set of my classroom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I waited for Black Friday to get this as I’ve been watching for it to go on sale. It is worth the price tag though. Thoughtful design with little people in mind. I like the rounded corners especially. My toddler tripped and fell into this today and I said to my husband “thank goodness these have rounded edges or that could’ve been bad”. Easy to assemble and sturdy. Worth it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good price, looks nice, reasonably easy to assemble (as manufacturer suggested, best done by 2 people). I bought 2, should have gotten 3. And…it has wheels! I didn’t realize that until it was being assembled. So easy to move!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and easy to assemble
reviews.reviewText: Packaging was fine but arrived slightly chipped. A good bookshelf overall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We have just purchased a new home and wanted to update our son's bedroom furniture. We came across these shelves and went ahead a purchased two. They were really easy to build and fit perfectly in my son's bedroom. It's as if they were actually made for a four year old. The height is perfect and he's able to get his toys in and out of the shelve safely. The corners are also safe. They give the feeling of school quality due to the safety standards. Great product, if needed will purchase again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great but had to exchange the first order
reviews.reviewText: This is a great toy shelf. I love and hate that it has wheels - love because I can easily to pull it away for cleaning the floor and baseboards, but hate also because my toddler sometimes drags it around the house lolThe first shelf that arrived had a massive crack in one of the main boards which was very disappointing and difficult to return. I'm hoping that the shelf I have won't crack and stays nice for years to come

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, easy to build, solid shelves
reviews.reviewText: I have no complaints except the instructions aren't the clearest. These shelves are solid, were easy for me to put together alone (once divider orientation was figured out), and are great in the nursery. They hold lots of items, especially with organizer baskets, and aren't a big risk of tipping due to the shorter height of 24" and a base depth of 13". They also seem to hold up so far to my kiddo banging his toys all over them. I chose not to use the casters, as my kid would just skate the shelves around the room if I did.The instructions are lacking. If you want pictures that demonstrate proper orientation, you will not get it. Step 1, the top divider goes onto the side with only 1 set of holes and the screws go into the bottom side where there are 3 sets of holes (two sets with plastic inserts). The slots in the wood need to all face to the back to hold the back panels, so watch your orientation with that as well. This is not clearly indicated in the pictures. It's easy to figure out if you have had to build a lot of pack flat furniture, but it may lose some people who haven't.Do not over tighten the pins that go in the plastic inserts, this can cause them to angle oddly, and then that can pull the plastic out when you go to put the pins in the dividers. It didn't happen with these for me, but it's happened with similar designs in the past, and I have seen review pictures where it looked like that had happened on these shelves.Over all, I have 3 of these and love them so far. If I needed more storage space, I wouldn't hesitate getting more. These beat those easily scratchable melamine laminate units, and easily chipable particle board units, any day of the week.
Very sturdy construction. Bought 2 for a daycare center & assembled in less than 1 hour. Exactly the same as sold in daycare supply catalogs.Very satisfied with purchase.

Algunas de las piezas venían mal terminadas, tuve que lijarlas para darles el terminado adecuado y no astillarme o que mi niña se astillara. Por todo lo demás está genial, tamaño, color (qué ojalá tuvieran más colores disponibles), muy fácil de armar y espacio interior.
These are fantastic quality, I've ordered 5 of them for my home daycare. Highly recommend and worth the money.

Really happy with this shelf! Building it was a little challenging as one of the parts was a little wonky (literally the only reason I deducted a star), but with a little help from my husband we were able to make it work. Obviously, don’t overdo it on screwing the screws in too tight, as there’s a risk of splitting the wood like with all wooden furniture. We had no issues with this and made sure not to overdo it. The shelf itself is solid and beautiful. I didn’t use the canisters and have it flat on our carpet. My daughter loves having her toys on display and that she’s able to reach them all. Really pleased with this purchase, and for such a reasonable price. Much sturdier than an IKEA piece, that’s for sure!

reviews.reviewTitle: Piece wrong measuring, impossible to assemble
reviews.reviewText: The furniture looks fine, but one of the pieces wasn’t the size that was supposed to be; therefore, impossible to assemble. Also, one of the parts is starting to split without even putting pressure on it.The vender asked me for pictures of the wrong part. No answer after sending them.I had to cut the piece myself with a professional tool that my neighbour happens to have.A bit pricey for having wrong a piece and a part being about to split.
